page.title: 04Thurnham
page.content: Dairy farming is the main industry. The cows are generally Friesian, but some Friesian/Hereford calves are bred for beef. Friesian heifer calves are reared for replacements to the dairy herd,. Bull calves and culled cows are sold at Lancaster Auction. Herds are between 40 and 80, and milk yield is 4500 - 6000 litres. Cows graze the fields from April to October, and are loose-housed in cubicles for the winter. Calves are fed milk for 4/5 days, then milk substitute until they are a month old and then weaned on to concentrates, hay and water.
